sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The tan function is used to find the tangent of an angle given in radians. For example, tan (p/4) is 0.5.
sections.text_content: The tan function is used to find the tangent of an angle given in radians. For example, tan (p/4) is 0.5.
sections.mdown_content: The **tan** function is used to find the tangent of an angle given in radians. For example, **tan** (p/4) is 0.5.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : 0 .. 12
            const angle := i * Math.PI / 6
            put "Tangent of ", angle, " is ", tan ( angle )
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the tangent of 0, p/6, 2p/6, 3p/6, up to 12p/6 radians.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the tangent of 0, p/6, 2p/6, 3p/6, up to 12p/6 radians.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the tangent of 0, p/6, 2p/6, 3p/6, up to 12p/6 radians.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: An argument to tan of p/2, 3*p/2, etc. may result in an overflow (and halt of the program) as the result is technically ¥. (It may not cause an overflow due to rounding, in which case the result will simply be a very large number.)
sections.text_content:
An argument to tan of p/2, 3*p/2, etc. may result in an overflow (and halt of the program) as the result is technically ¥. 
(It may not cause an overflow due to rounding, in which case the result will simply be a very large number.)
sections.mdown_content: An argument to **tan** of p/2, 3*p/2, etc. may result in an overflow (and halt of the program) as the result is technically ¥. (It may not cause an overflow due to rounding, in which case the result will simply be a very large number.)

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the sin and cos functions for calculating sine and cosine.

the tand function which finds the tangent of an angle given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit Math.
sections.text_content:
the sin and cos functions for calculating sine and cosine.
the tand function which finds the tangent of an angle given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit Math.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[sin.html](sin)** and **[cos.html](cos)** functions for calculating sine and cosine.
the **[tand.html](tand)** function which finds the tangent of an angle given in degrees. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit **[mathmodule.html](Math)**.
